intro: Annickia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy annickia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Annickia pilosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
